question: 彫る
sourceMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>carve</kanji> and the verb version is <vocabulary>to carve something</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>to engrave something</vocabulary>.

This is a transitive verb, meaning it can take a direct object. You engrave letters into a stone, and you carve a scary face into a pumpkin. Those letters and that face are your objects.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Imagine trying <vocabulary>to carve something</vocabulary> using a <reading>hoe</reading> (<ja>ほ</ja>). Its long handle makes it a pretty impractical tool for carving. Now imagine all the trouble you have carving with it.
